Equipping Sacred Seals:
You can equip allies with seals
you've received. Each ally can
equip one seal.

Sacred Seal Limitation:
You cannot have more than one
of the same Sacred Seal. Any
duplicates will be converted into
Hero Feathers automatically.
$aThis skill can be learned by units $a0★ and higher.

Get rewards if your army wins,
for high-ranking scores, and more!
You'll keep fighting with this army.
Choose a new army to support.
Results after round ends aren't counted.

$a$a0 is over. You cannot
move on at this point.
You'll now return to the world map.
You were unable to join the army.
Cheer your favorite Hero to victory!

Voting Gauntlet:
Begin by selecting 1 of 8 Heroes
to support. You'll join that Hero's
army to battle another Hero's
army in a team vs. team format.

Victory Conditions:
The army with the most points
when time runs out will be
declared the winner.

Battles:
After you battle, you won't be able
to battle again in support of your
Hero's army for a set period
of time.

Battle Format:
The battles are 3-on-3. The
following will be on your team.

・Your leader
・A friend, if you have friends
registered
・A player you have not
registered as a friend

Attack Power Selection:
After you win a battle, you can
multiply your score by using
Battle Flags.

The more you use, the more
points you contribute to your
Hero's army.

Check Rewards:
You can check the current
rewards. Change the filter
to see rewards for the current
round and cumulative results.

Rank:
This is your current rank. Ranks
are calculated at the top of every
hour. Note that it may take time
for updated placement
information to be reflected.
Select a source and recipient for skill inheritance.

If inherited, the source character
will vanish.
Select up to three skills to inherit.

Inheriting Skills:
An ally can inherit up to three
skills at a time from another
ally. You'll lose the ally
donating any skills.

Inherited skills are added to
the recipient's skill list. They
are learned like any other skill
but require 1.5x the usual SP.

Note that any ally marked as a
favorite can't be used as a
source for inheriting skills.

To remove a favorite mark,
hold down on the ally's icon
and then tap the favorite mark
on the ally's profile screen.

$aOne of these skills is required:
$a0 or $a1.

Rewards:
After the season ends, you'll get
rewards based on your high
score and tier. If your score
is high enough, your Arena tier
may go up.

Character Bonus:
You can double the score you
earn for your offensive and
defensive teams each season by
using certain characters.

Checking Rewards:
You can check the rewards that
will be given out for the current
season. Change the filter to see
rewards given for your offense,
defense, and tier.

Tier Rewards:
This reward list shows rewards
for your current tier as well as
tiers close to yours. Placements
are calculated at the start of
every hour. Note that it may take
some time to reflect changes
after the calculations begin.

Squad Assault:
After clearing one map, you'll
immediately continue to the
next map.

Heroes who participate in battle
are captured after one map and
cannot join the fight later.

Four Heroes per Map:
Each map requires four Heroes.
You must have enough Heroes
to complete all maps in a set.

For example, for five battles, you
will need 20 unique Heroes.
(Duplicates do not count.)

The Rules:
・ You cannot place a Hero and
their duplicate on the same team.

・ Heroes who participate in one
battle cannot participate in later
maps in a set. (Duplicate Heroes
cannot be used later either.)

Releasing Heroes:
Once you clear a set of maps or
get a game over, all Heroes will
be released.

This means that all your Heroes
will be free to battle once again.

More battles have been added to
Chain Challenge.

More battles have been added to
Squad Assault.

You cannot use two or more
of the same Hero on a team.

You do not have enough allies.
Each team must have four
unique allies with no duplicates.
Play several maps in a row.

Please select options for
sorting and set priority.

$aYou can't use duplicate Heroes in battle.
Lead your allies to a $a0-streak victory!

Select up to three items to bring into battle.
Unused items will not be consumed. New
items will sometimes appear in the Arena.

This does not require a Dueling Sword.

You can earn EXP, SP, and HM for the
first battle each day only.

This does not require a Dueling Sword.

Note: You will not earn EXP, SP, or HM
from the second battle onward each day.

Do you want to surrender?
You won't be able to continue.

If you surrender, your score
will be based on the number of
maps you've cleared this time.

Test your skills against rivals from
around the world, and earn rewards.
Aim for seven consecutive victories!

$aThis special Arena requires multiple
teams and is designed for advanced
players. Your goal: $a0 victories in a row!

Hero Profiles:
Tap a Hero for info. Heroes you
have fought will be silhouetted.
Your allies have full profiles.

Quotes:
You can view the Hero's dialogue
here—what they say both when
they were first summoned and
when they reach maximum stars.
Allies with maximum stars also
have a brighter border in the list
screen.

Illustrations:
Tap the magnifying glass icon to
view full-size character artwork.

Mini Unit:
You can tap the mini unit to
trigger an animation.

This will remove the ! icon from
any newly allied Heroes. Proceed?
Now showing presents accepted in the last 14 days.

A valuable ceremonial coin
used in antiquity.

This item would have no effect if used
now, so the item cannot be used.

Please select the item
you would like to use.
Use your teams and keep winning!

Arena Assault:
A battle arena for advanced
players. The goal is to use
multiple teams to clear many
maps in a row.
Figure out the best time to use
your special items, and defeat
challenging foes who lie in wait!

Dueling Swords:
No Dueling Swords are required
for this mode, so keep on trying!

Opponent Strength:
The strength of your opponents
for each round is based on the
strength of your starting team.

Earn Special Items:
Defeat teams that include level
35+ enemies, and you'll get items
based on consecutive wins:

3 consecutive wins: 1 item
5 consecutive wins: 2 items
7 consecutive wins: 3 items

Bring Items Along:
When you attempt a series of
battles in Arena Assault, you'll
be able to bring items into battle.

You can then use the items
to your advantage during battle!

The Rules:
・ You cannot place a Hero and
their duplicate on the same team.

・ Heroes who participate in one
battle cannot participate in later
maps in a set. (Duplicate Heroes
cannot be used later either.)

Releasing Heroes:
Once you clear a set of maps or
get a game over, all Heroes will
be released.

This means that all your Heroes
will be free to battle once again.

Score:
Your score will be based on the
strength of the opponents you've
beaten.

During a winning streak, you'll get
a chain bonus.

High Score:
This is the highest score you've
earned. It will reset each season.

Rewards:
After each season ends, you
can receive rewards based on
your rank.

Bonus Character Stat Boost:
When bonus characters are used
within Tempest Trials, they'll be
granted HP+10 and Atk/Spd/
Def/Res+4.

Checking Rewards:
You can check the rewards that
will be given out for the current
season.

Receiving Rewards:
You can receive Arena Assault
rewards you earned in the
previous season by entering
Arena Assault after that season's
results have been calculated but
before the current season ends.

The session ends when you select a Hero.
The colorless Hero Lyn is most popular!

Choose one Hero to summon.
(You can only choose one now.)

You can summon one time for free.
Afterward, you'll have to use Orbs.

Some skills cannot be inherited
through Inherit Skill.

Using Merge Allies on duplicate
Heroes will allow you to inherit
all skills.

Please select a team to call. Reserve
teams are used in multi-map battles.

Reserve teams are a special kind
of team. These teams can only be
created or edited while playing
modes that feature multi-map
battles.
Select the team you wish to edit.
Select the reserve team you wish to edit.

The allies share a bond stronger than steel.
Fighting together will yield a higher stat boost.

You share a bond stronger than steel.
Your ally's stats are further increased.

Ally Support:
Allies can create bonds by
forming partnerships with one
another.

When partners fight near each
other, they'll gain an advantage
on the battlefield.

Creating Bonds:
Create a bond by selecting two
allies to become partners.

Their Support Rank will start at C.

Increasing Support Ranks:
If partners are within at least two
spaces of each other and battle
foes level 35 or higher, their bond
will grow stronger.

Their Support Rank will increase
once their bond grows strong
enough. The possible ranks are C,
B, A, and S.

Support Effects 1:
Partners at Support Rank C or
higher will gain a stat boost when
they fight right next to each other.

C: Res+2
B: Def/Res+2
A: Spd/Def/Res+2
S: Atk/Spd/Def/Res+2

Support Effects 2:
Partners will also receive a stat
boost when there's one space
between them, but the boost
will not be as strong.

C: Res+1
B: Def/Res+1
A: Spd/Def/Res+1
S: Atk/Spd/Def/Res+1

Ally Support Limits:
Each ally can have only one
partner at a time. It is possible
to change an ally's partner, but
doing so will reset the Support
Rank with their current partner.

Summoner Support:
As the Summoner, you can
choose an ally to form a bond
with.

The ally you choose to support
will gain a stat boost.

Forming a Bond:
Select an ally to support to start
forming your bond.

Your Support Rank will start at C.

Increasing Support Rank:
When your chosen ally battles
foes level 35 or higher, the bond
between you and the ally will
grow stronger.

Your Support Rank will increase
once your bond grows strong
enough. The possible ranks are
C, B, A, and S.

Summoner Support Effects:
When your Support Rank is C or
higher, your chosen ally will
receive a persistent stat boost.

C: HP+3, Res+2
B: HP+4, Def/Res+2
A: HP+4, Spd/Def/Res+2
S: HP+5, Atk/Spd/Def/Res+2

Summoner Support Limits:
You can support only one ally at
a time. It is possible to change
which ally you're supporting, but
doing so will reset the Support
Rank with your current ally.

The Weapon Refinery
has been unlocked.
Select a character with a skill you want to refine.
This refined skill cannot be inherited.

Weapon Refinery:
You can refine weapons to make
them more powerful.

Refining requires Refining
Stones, Arena Medals, and SP.
Arena Medals can be obtained in
the Arena.

Divine Dew:
To refine some weapons, you will
need Divine Dew instead of
Refining Stones.

Divine Dew can be created in the
Weapon Refinery by using Refining
Stones.

Conferring Blessings:
Use a Blessing item to confer
a blessing on your allies.

Blessings cannot be conferred on
Fjorm or other Legendary Heroes.

Blessing Effects #1:
Blessed allies receive double
the usual amount of SP.

Please note that while blessings
cannot be conferred on
Legendary Heroes, Legendary
Heroes will always earn double
the usual amount of SP in battle.

Blessing Effects #2:
Match a Legendary Hero, the
current season's type, and your
allies' blessings to earn a bonus.

For example, go into battle with
the Water-type Legendary Hero
Fjorm during Water season with
Water-blessed allies to earn
a bonus of HP+3 and Spd+3.

Season Schedule:
You can check the top of the
Battle screen and other locations
for info on the current season.

Legendary Heroes:
Legendary Heroes have a special
icon on their profile screen. Tap
the icon to check what type of
Legendary Effect they have.

・Obtain double EXP & SP from battles.
・During Fire season, gain a special
boost from a Fire-type Legendary
Hero when you go into battle with
that Legendary Hero.

・Obtain double EXP & SP from battles.
・During Water season, gain a special
boost from a Water-type Legendary
Hero when you go into battle with
that Legendary Hero.

・Obtain double EXP & SP from battles.
・During Wind season, gain a special
boost from a Wind-type Legendary
Hero when you go into battle with
that Legendary Hero.

・Obtain double EXP & SP from battles.
・During Earth season, gain a special
boost from an Earth-type Legendary
Hero when you go into battle with
that Legendary Hero.

Confer the Earth blessing?

boost if they go into battle with
an Earth-type Legendary Hero
during Earth season.

If you confer a new blessing, any existing
blessing and its effects will be canceled.

It's a hot spring! Everyone's having a
great time chatting together, warmed
by the water.
Tap to defeat waves of enemies!

Tap Battle:
This is an action game where you
tap the screen to defeat enemies.

Please try playing with the music
and character voices on.

How to Play:
Tap the Summoner at the bottom
of the screen to attack. If your
timing is just right, enemies
will be hit with a critical attack
and fly off-screen. You can rack
up a combo by landing multiple
critical attacks in a row.
In expert mode, tap the rows!

Expert Mode:
In casual mode, you tap the
Summoner at the bottom of the
screen. There is also an expert
mode where you can tap each
ally's row to make them attack.

Playable Stages:
Not all stages will be available
immediately after the event
begins.

Once a set amount of time has
passed, new stages will become
playable.

Tap Battle Settings:
If you feel the timing isn't quite
right, try adjusting your settings.

You might find it's easier to
play if you adjust the input timing
or turn the sound effects and
voices off.

Tap Battle Settings:
Adjust your settings to make the
game more enjoyable to play.

If you feel that your input timing
isn't quite right, try adjusting
the timing settings here.

Adjust Timing:
You can adjust the input timing
by tapping in time with the beat.
After that, if you feel the timing
isn't quite right, you can make
manual adjustments. Raise the
value if it's too fast, or lower it if
it's too slow.

Sound Effects and Voice:
You can also disable the
sound effects or character
voices. Turning sounds on
and off in Tap Battle Settings
applies only to Tap Battles.
Those who are blessed, do battle!

Blessed Gardens:
"A heavenly domain where vast
treasure sleeps..." That's how the
legends describe these ancient
gardens. Only Legendary Heroes
and Heroes who have had a
blessing conferred on them can
enter these hallowed grounds.

Rules for Blessed Gardens:
The only Heroes that can set foot
in the Garden of Water are
Water-type Legendary Heroes
and Heroes with the Water
Blessing conferred on them.
The gardens of Wind, Earth,
and Fire work the same way.

Rules for Blessed Gardens:
・ Your team must have four
allies.
・ Your team may not contain
duplicate Heroes.
・ You cannot use a Light's
Blessing.

Legendary Effects:
・ In the Blessed Gardens, effects
from Legendary Heroes will
always be active, regardless of
the current season.
・ To confer a blessing, tap Allies,
then Advanced Growth, and Confer
Blessing.

Only Water-type Legendary Heroes
and Water-blessed Heroes can enter.

Only Wind-type Legendary Heroes
and Wind-blessed Heroes can enter.

Only Earth-type Legendary Heroes
and Earth-blessed Heroes can enter.

Only Fire-type Legendary Heroes
and Fire-blessed Heroes can enter.

This map can be accessed only
by teams made up of Fire-type
Legendary Heroes and Heroes
with the Fire blessing.

This map can be accessed only
by teams made up of Water-type
Legendary Heroes and Heroes
with the Water blessing.

This map can be accessed only
by teams made up of Wind-type
Legendary Heroes and Heroes
with the Wind blessing.

This map can be accessed only
by teams made up of Earth-type
Legendary Heroes and Heroes
with the Earth blessing.

The Blessed Gardens have been
unlocked.

Your team must have four allies. It may
not contain duplicate Heroes.

You can include only one ally
that can use Sing or Dance
in your brigade, and duplicate
Heroes are not allowed.

Your brigade contains characters
that cannot be used together.

With a brigade of 20 allies, take
on Rival Domains!

Edit Brigades:
A brigade is the team you use in
Rival Domains.
You can choose up to 20 allies
from your army or your friends'.
Any empty slots will automatically
be filled with reinforcements.

Brigade Limits:
・ You can include only one ally
who can use the abilities Sing or
Dance within your brigade.
・ Your brigade may not contain
duplicate Heroes.

Rules for Rival Domains:
・ The battle won't end even if
one side's forces are depleted—
fresh troops will continue the fight.
・ The battle will end after 10 turns
have passed or one side's
fortress is destroyed.
・ You will not earn EXP or SP.
・ Reinforcements will not gain
boosts from Legendary Effects.

About Fortresses:
・ It takes three hits to destroy a
fortress.
・ You can warp to a fortress you
control.
・ Allies in a fortress recover 10
HP per turn.
・ Fortresses are considered
defensive terrain.

About Camps:
・ It takes two hits to defeat a
camp. It then becomes yours.
・ You can warp to a camp you
control.
・ Allies in a camp recover 10
HP per turn.
・ Camps are considered
defensive terrain.

Warping:
Allies adjacent to a fortress or
camp they control can instantly
warp to a space adjacent to
another fortress or camp they
control.

Rival Domains Scoring:
You'll receive a score after
the battle has ended.

You can earn a higher score
by protecting your fortress and
camps while defeating foes and
capturing the enemy's fortress.

Would you like to update your friends'
allies to their most current state?

All of your friends' allies
will be updated.

You can't battle in this
area. It's an army's HQ.

$aKnockout: $a0!
No battling till the next round.

This area doesn't border enemy
territory. You can't battle here.

This area doesn't border allied
territory. You can't battle here.

Grand Conquests:
In Grand Conquests, three armies
battle to conquer territory across
a continent.

When the battle ends, the armies
will earn rewards. The more
areas a team controls, the better
the rewards!

How to Participate:
Select an area that is adjacent to
an enemy to enter battle and earn
points. Entering battle consumes
Grand Conquests-specific
stamina. Use the boost option to
consume more stamina and
multiply your score!

Score Effects:
After you battle, you'll earn a
score. Points will be added to
your army's total in the area
you've selected.

Controlling Areas:
・The army that controls an area
at the beginning of a round will
accrue points.
・The army with the most points
at the end of a round will gain
control of that area.

Cooperation Bonus:
During each round, bonus points
will be applied to the total points
earned in an area, based on the
number of allies who battle in the
area during the round.

Helping Out:
・You can help out once per
round.
・Helping out boosts the number
of allies battling in a randomly
selected area by 1, which helps
boost the cooperation bonus.
You might also randomly gain
an item.

Getting Knocked Out:
・Armies can be knocked out
mid-round when battle conditions
are calculated. If the difference
between first and second place
armies exceeds the threshold,
the winner gains the area
immediately.
・If this happens, no battles can
be fought in the area for the
remainder of the round.

GC Tiers:
・Your GC Tier will increase
based on your cumulative score
in battle.
・The higher your GC Tier is, the
more points get added to areas
adjacent to your selected area.
・You can also earn other
rewards based on your GC Tier.

$aYour GC Tier has increased from
$a0 to $a1.

Rules for Rival Domains:
・ The battle won't end even if
one side's forces are depleted—
fresh troops will continue the fight.
・ The battle will end after 10 turns
have passed or one side's
fortress is destroyed.

More Rules for Rival Domains:
・Legendary Effects will not
trigger for reinforcements.
・You cannot earn EXP or SP.
・Bonds from ally support or
summoner support will not
grow stronger.

Battles:
After a victory, you won't be able
to battle again in support of your
Hero's army for a set period
of time.

How Scoring Works:
If you win, you'll earn points
based on the strength of your foe.
During a winning streak, you'll get
a chain bonus. This bonus resets
after your fifth straight win.

Rewards:
After the season ends, you'll get
rewards based on your tier.

If your score is high enough,
your Arena tier may go up.

Bonus Character Stat Boost:
When bonus characters are used
within the Arena, they'll be
granted HP+10 and Atk/Spd/
Def/Res+4.

This stat boost does not affect
the scores for foes you are
matched with. It also does not
apply to your defensive team.

Checking Rewards:
You can check the rewards that
will be given out for the current
season. Change the filter to see
rewards given for your defense
and rank.

Defense Rewards:
These rewards are based on the
score your team has earned
for defense.

Test your skills against rivals from
around the world, and earn rewards.
Aim for five consecutive victories!

with the privacy policy.

collection of your app usage data
has been stopped.

If you wish to stop notifications
outside of the app, please change
the settings on your device.

To access Extra Stages,
clear at least Floor 20 in
the 100-floor dungeon.

Legendary Effects:
・ In the Blessed Gardens, effects
from Legendary Heroes will
always be active, regardless of
the current season.
・ To confer a blessing, tap Allies,
then Ally Growth, and Confer
Blessing.

$aYou cannot have more than one of the
same accessory. Any duplicates will
be converted into $a0 Hero Feathers.

$aYou cannot have more than one of the
same Sacred Seal or accessory. Any
duplicates will be converted into
$a0 Hero Feathers.

Blessing Bonus:
Each time you send a Legendary
or blessed Hero from the current
season into battle, you'll receive
a score bonus of +1 when battle
concludes.

(This goes into effect starting
with the season beginning
after ver. 2.6.0 is released.)

Looks like everyone is having a
blast after diving in!

Equip Accessories:
You can dress up your allies
by equipping them with
accessories you've obtained.

Each accessory can be
equipped on one ally at a time.

Accessory Type:
There are different categories of
accessories, as shown by the
pink icon.

① Tap the ally to be swapped out.
② Tap the ally to be put in.

Blessing Effects #1:
Blessed allies receive double the
usual amount of SP and EXP
in battle.

Blessings cannot be conferred on
Legendary Heroes. However,
Legendary Heroes will always earn
double the usual amount of SP and
EXP in battle.

Claim your reward from the quest list.

GC Tiers:
・Your GC Tier will increase
based on your cumulative score
in battle.
・As your GC Tier increases,
more points get added to areas
adjacent to your selected area.
This begins with the next battle
after a GC Tier rank promotion.
・You can also earn other
rewards based on your GC Tier.

Review the fundamentals
and hone your technique.

Learn how different skills
affect the fight.

Veteran tacticians, these
challenges are for you.

Tactics Drills:
Brush up on the rules of Fire
Emblem Heroes, and hone your
tactical skills while playing.

Each map features a preselected
group of allies.

Grandmaster:
These maps are extremely
challenging!

They will be unlocked after you
clear Book I, Chapter 13 in the
main story.

A new Tactics Drills map is
available.

Win battles and grow closer to
the characters in this event.

Equip these accessories on your team to
boost the amount your friendships grow!

You cannot choose the character you
grow closer to or the amount your
friendship grows. Equipping bonus
accessories on the allies on your
battle team will speed things up!

$aReward for achieving a total score of $a0
with $a1:

Because the battle lasted past the
end of the season, the results were
not counted.

Forging Bonds:
Clear the maps and Heroes will
share their feelings.

As you continue to play, they will
share special messages, and you
can earn accessories too.

Event Recap:
Once you've seen a special
conversation, it'll be added to
Event Recap, where you can
view it again any time you want.

Daily Orb Reward:
For the first seven days, earn 2
Orbs per day by clearing a map.

All Heroes have already reached
the maximum friendship level.

You can continue participating in this
event even after watching the ending.

For the first seven days, earn 2 Orbs
per day by clearing a map.

Plus One for Bonus Heroes:
Whenever you defeat a foe using
a bonus Hero, you will earn three
extra points toward your score.

(This goes into effect starting
with the season beginning
after ver. 2.8.0 is released.)

Grounds:
・ Fight using multiple teams.
・ Heroes who participate in one
battle cannot participate in later
battles in a set. (Duplicate Heroes
cannot be used later either.)
A crown awarded to a legendary summoner.

Blessing Bonus:
Each time you send a Legendary
or blessed Hero from the current
season into battle, you'll receive
a score bonus of +1 when battle
concludes.

The session ends when you select a Hero.
The colorless Hero Lyn is most popular!

More Rules for Rival Domains:
・Legendary Effects will not
trigger for reinforcements.

Save the selected skills and

Equip the saved skill set now?

Enter a name for this skill set.

This name will be used for all allies using

Any Sacred Seals currently equipped
on other allies will be removed.

The same Sacred Seal appears
multiple times in this set. It will be
equipped on only one ally.

Edit/Equip Skill Sets:
Skill sets allow you to quickly
swap out skills and Sacred Seals.

You can save up to five skill sets
for each ally.

Edit Skill Sets:
Select the skills and Sacred Seal
you would like to save to the skill
set.

Equip Skill Sets:
The selected skills and Sacred
Seals can all be equipped at once.

Edit the Skill Set name:
You can edit the names of the skill
sets you register. Note that skill
set names will be shared among
all characters.

Equip Skill Sets:
Equip one or more characters
with registered skill sets using the
Edit/Equip Skill Sets menu.

Select by Ally:
Select one ally at a time, and
equip skill sets to them
individually.

Select by Team
You can select from different
types of teams and assign all team
members skill sets simultaneously.

Brigades that do not include any
allies from your army will not be
displayed.

Equipping Sacred Seals:
If equipping skill sets will result in
multiple allies attempting to equip
the same Sacred Seal, the ally
who comes first in the sort order
will take priority.

Points are earned based on the number of
areas controlled at the end of a round.
$aIn round $a0, each area controlled scores 1 point.
The session ends when you select a Hero.

Plus Three for Bonus Heroes:
Whenever you defeat a foe using
a bonus Hero, you will earn three
extra points toward your score.
Results after round ends aren't counted.

Earn 2 Orbs every day by clearing a
map (for a maximum of seven days).

Daily Orb Reward:
Earn 2 Orbs every day by clearing
a map (for a maximum of seven
days).

Swap Left/Right:
Turn this option on to swap the
side of the screen the foes and
your army appear on.

Speed:
The movement speed of foes can
be boosted to up to 3x normal.
Boss movement speed is
unaffected by this setting.
After two turns, new allies arrive!

Relay Defense:
・ From a brigade of 20 total
allies, five will join the battle.
・ On turns 3, 5, and 7, your
current team of five will exit the
battlefield and five new allies will
enter.
・ The battle ends on turn 8 or
if your fortress is destroyed.

About Fortresses:
・ It takes three hits to destroy a
fortress.
・ You can warp to a fortress you
control.
・ Allies in your fortress recover
10 HP at start of turn.
・ Fortresses are considered
defensive terrain.

About Camps:
・ It takes two hits to defeat a
camp.
・ You can warp to a camp you
control.
・ Allies in a camp recover 10
HP at start of turn.
・ Camps are considered
defensive terrain.

Warping:
Allies adjacent to a fortress or
camp you control can instantly
warp to a space adjacent to
another fortress or camp you
control.

Relay Defense Scoring:
You'll receive a score after
the battle has ended.

You can earn a higher score
by protecting your fortress and
camps while helping your allies
survive until they rotate out.

More Rules for Relay Defense:
・ Enemy reinforcements will
appear.
・ Hero Merit cannot be earned.

Return selected character to

Combat Manual:
A Combat Manual can be used in
place of an ally in Merge Allies,
Inherit Skill, and more.
Select a character to raise ★ rating.
Select the number of Combat Manuals to enhance.

Allies that are sent home will be
removed from your barracks.

Once an ally is removed from
your barracks, you will lose the
ally permanently. Do you still want
to send them home?

Creating Combat Manuals:
You can choose to send an ally
home and, in return, receive their
Combat Manual. You will lose any
ally whose Combat Manual you
obtain, so be careful.

Using Combat Manuals 1:
In places where you might use
an ally, such as Merge Allies or
Inherit Skill, you can use a combat
Manual instead.

Just like a Hero, a Combat Manual
can have its ★ rating raised via
Unlock Potential.

Using Combat Manuals 2:
The following will not be included
in the Combat Manual:

・ Levels and EXP
・ Skills that were learned
・ Skills that were inherited or
refined
・ The number of merges
・ Blessings conferred

Exchanging Combat Manuals:
A Combat Manual can be
exchanged for Hero Feathers.
You will lose any Combat Manual
you exchange for Hero Feathers,
so be careful.

You have reached the limit on Combat
Manuals. You cannot create any more.

You have reached the limit on Combat
Manuals. You cannot unlock the
potential of any more.
Reset this skill set to default (blank)?

Unlocking Ally Potential:
If you raise an ally's ★ rating, you'll
unlock more of their potential.
You'll need specific items.

The ally's level will return to 1
but at a higher ★ rating. They will
have raised stats and access to
stronger skills.

You created a Combat Manual.

To see the list of Combat Manuals
you have, tap Your Manuals.

Edit Brigades:
A brigade is a team you use in
large battles, like Rival Domains.
You can choose up to 20 allies
from your barracks or your
friends'. Any empty slots will
automatically be filled with
reinforcements.

Structures defensive teams use for support.
Traps are triggered when foes end movement on one.
Structures that store and restore Aether.
Decorative structures with no combat function.
Structures raiding parties use for support.
Replay data could not be accessed.

The offense map is used when
attacking a foe's Aether Keep.

The defense map is for when you
need to defend your Aether Keep.

Fortifying Your Aether Keep:
Place structures and allies to
fortify your offense and defense
maps.

Defense Map:
Place defensive structures, traps,
resources, ornaments, and allies.

Defensive Team:
You can place your defensive
team in the top two rows of your
defense map.

Offense Map:
Place offensive structures.

Raiding Party:
The raiding party will be placed
one row above the offense map.

Placing Defensive Structures:
Defensive structures, resources,
traps, and ornaments can be
placed in any open space other
than special terrain (forests,
trenches, etc.).

Permanent Structures:
Fortresses and resources cannot
be removed.

Destroying Structures:
Fortresses cannot be destroyed.
Other structures can be
destroyed with a single attack.

Auto Setup:
You can use this function to both
automatically build, place, and
improve structures at your
choosing, as well as create and
place defensive teams. Note:
Aether Stones and Heavenly Dew
will be consumed as required to
create or strengthen structures.

Test Defense:
Test your defense map's defenses
and your defensive team's mettle
without consuming Aether.

Testing Outside the Season:
After a season ends but before
the next season begins, Test
Defenses is treated as part
of the next season.

Place/Remove Structures:
Place and remove the structures
you've finished building.

Structure Limit:
You can place only a certain
number of each type of structure.

Build Structures:
Use Aether Stones and Heavenly
Dew to build new structures.

Improve Structures:
Use Aether Stones and Heavenly
Dew to improve structures by
one level.

Limited-Time Structures:
Some structures are available to
build for a limited time. To build
them, you'll need items obtainable
only during a set time period.
Once created, however, the
structures are yours to keep.

Terrain:
Change the terrain of your Aether
Keep.

Some terrain requires Aether
Stones to unlock.

Aether Raids:
Place structures, a defensive
team, and more on your maps,
and then attack or defend to
increase your Lift.

If the defender is defeated within
seven turns, the attacker wins.

Aether:
This is used to take part in Aether
Raids. It's replenished by a fixed
amount once a day. It is totally
replenished at the start of a new
season.
Note: It cannot be replenished
beyond the maximum amount.
The higher your Lift, the more
Aether you'll need to battle.

Lift and Tier:
・ Your Lift will change based on
your attack and defense results.
・ Your Tier is based on your Lift.
・ When a new season begins, you
will start the season with an
amount of Lift based on your Tier
(beginning from AR Tier 12.)

Acquiring Lift:
・ Putting a bonus character in
your raiding party will give you a
+20 bonus to Lift.
・ The defensive side's maximum
Lift will not be reduced.
・ If you have multiple bonus
characters, only the single highest
bonus value is applied.
・ If your raiding party is defeated,
you will acquire less Lift.

Special Conditions:
If your Lift is 4,000 or lower, a
failed attack or defense will not
lower your total Lift.

Additional Information:
If a battle does not end properly,
neither the attacker nor the
defender will see a change in
their total Lift.

Bonus Characters Stat Boost:
When bonus characters are used
in Aether Raids, they'll be granted
HP+10 and Atk/Spd/Def/Res+4.
The amount of EXP and SP they
gain will be doubled.

Bonus Structures:
Place bonus structures in your
Aether Keep to increase the
Fortress (O) or Fortress (D) by
one level.

Fortress (D) and Tier Demotion:
If you're demoted to a lower Tier,
the level of your Fortress (D) will
be lowered.

Checking Rewards:
You can check the rewards you
can earn for the current season.

Receiving Rewards:
You can receive Aether Raids
rewards earned in the previous
season by entering Aether Raids
after that season's results have
been calculated but before the
current season ends.

Defense Results:
This list shows your defense
results for Aether Raids. You can
see how much Lift you earned
for each win and loss, as well as
the number of foes defeated.

Replay:
This lets you watch past defensive
battles against opponents.

Rematch:
You can attack an opponent that
defeated your defenses one time.
This will consume Aether. If the
same opponent appears on your
list multiple times, you can only
challenge them to a rematch once.

Lift Decrease Limit:
If you're attacked once, for the
next 20 hours, your Lift will not
decrease even if your defense
fails.

Rank:
This is your current rank.
Note that it may take time
for updated placement
information to be reflected.

Your Rank and Top Players:
These options show player
rankings for the current season.

Friends:
This option shows your friends'
rankings for the current season
and past seasons.

prepare for battle.

The offense map is used when
invading your foe's keep.

The defense map is used when
defending against a foe's attack.

$aAt start of turn, inflicts Atk/Spd/Def/Res-$a0

Note: Only one school can be placed at a time.

$aAt start of turn, if any foes are within 7 rows

into penalties through their next actions.

If structure's level > opponent's Fortress (D)

(X = difference in level × 4).
Note: Cannot be removed or destroyed.

$aAt the start of turn 3, deals $a0 damage to
foes within 3 columns centered on structure.

$aAt start of turn, if any foes are within the same
column as structure and their HP ≤ $a0 and

within the same column as this structure if
their level ≤ this structure's level.
Note: Fortress (D), traps, resources, and
ornaments cannot be destroyed.

through their next actions. (Cancels foe's

Edit Raiding Parties:
Edit your raiding parties for use in
Aether Raids.

Maximum Lift:
The maximum amount of Lift
acquired when a raiding party
makes a successful attack.

Increase Raiding Party Size:
If you increase your Tier in
Aether Raids, you'll be able
to add a 5th unit to your
raiding party. Aether Stones
are required to unlock
additional unit slots.

Additional Unit Slot Conditions:
You must reach Tier 11 or
higher to add a 5th ally.

$aUse $a0 Aether Stones
to add an ally?

$aIf you drop below Tier $a0 or
lower, the additional ally will not
be deployed.

This is the largest amount of Lift you can lose
given the makeup of your defensive team.

Lock this team?

All team members' current levels,
stats, skills, Sacred Seals, and
blessings will be locked, but only
for Aether Raids defense battles.

Unlock this team?

All team members' stats and
equipment will reflect the most
recent changes.
A defensive team has not been set.

When no units have been set to
the defensive team, level 40
Alfonse, Sharena, and Anna will
defend in place of other units.

Edit Defensive Team:
Edit the team that foes will battle
on defense maps.

Defensive Team Lock:
All members' current levels, stats,
skills, Sacred Seals, and blessings
will be locked, but only for Aether
Raids defense battles. Unlocking
the team will allow the most
recent changes to the units to be
reflected.

Increasing Defensive Team Size:
You can increase the size of your
defensive team if you raise your
AR Tier. You can get up to six
unit slots total. Aether Stones are
required to unlock additional slots.

Additional Unit Slot Conditions:
To get a 5th slot, you must reach
Tier 11 or higher. To get a 6th
slot, you must reach Tier 19 or
higher. If your Tier declines, you
will not be able to deploy units in
these slots. Regaining your Tier
will make them deployable again.

If There Are No Defenders:
When no units have been set to
the defensive team, level 40
Alfonse, Sharena, and Anna will
defend in place of other units.

You don't have enough Heroic
Grails to summon.

You have reached your maximum
number of allies.

Heroic Grails:
Use Heroic Grails to summon
specific Heroes to your barracks!
You can earn Heroic Grails from
Aether Raids and other sources.

More Information:
You can summon the same Hero
up to 20 times using Heroic Grails.

The number of Heroic Grails
needed will increase each time
you summon a Hero.

More Rules for Relay Defense:
・ Enemy reinforcements will
appear.

Reserve teams are a type of team
that can only be created or edited
while playing modes that feature
multi-map battles.

Defense Team:
You can set a team to use for
defensive battles under
Edit Teams.

as the active period is over. Your

Use a bonus ally to get a higher score.
Put one on your team to raise your score!

Do you want to surrender?
You won't be able to continue.

If you surrender, your score
will be based on the number of

Because the battle lasted past the
end of the season, the results were

Use your teams to clear the maps!

Tempest Trials:
In this mode, you'll battle through
multiple maps in a row. After
you clear one, the next will
appear immediately. Your allies
will not gain HP between battles.

Your goal: clear all of the maps!

Changing Teams:
If all of the allies you start with
are defeated, you can choose
a new set of allies and try again.

However, it's game over if you
lose too many battles!

About Your Score:
Your score is based on how well
you battled through a set of
maps.

Rewards are based on the
cumulative score earned during
the event period.

Bonus Allies:
If you include a bonus ally on your
team, you can increase your
score.

If you add multiple bonus allies,
only the highest bonus will apply.
Bonuses do not stack.

Check Rewards:
You can select Check Rewards if
you want to see the current
rewards.

Use the score options to view
rewards based on score or rank.

Rewards by Score:
You can view the rewards
for this event based on
your cumulative score.

Rewards by Rank:
You can view the rewards
based on rank. The top 500,000
scores are ranked.

Note that it may take some
time to reflect changes after the
calculations begin.

Receiving Rewards:
If you clear the score goal, you'll
qualify for a cumulative reward.
If earned, you can receive rank
rewards by entering Tempest
Trials after results have been
calculated but before the current
season ends.
Please enter a name for this team.

Choose a name of 12 or fewer characters.
Some symbols cannot be used.

Edit Team Name:
Using this option, you can name
your teams.

Set Defensive Team:
You can set which team will
defend in the Arena. The team
will be marked by a shield icon.
